text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with pan fried butter beans so I
took some which normally healthy butter
beans and tried to make them less
healthy and by less healthy I mean more
delicious and by the way I'm kidding
these are totally healthy we're gonna
take a little bit of olive oil in a
non-stick pan I'm gonna add a very
well-drained can of butter beans alright
so those are drained and rinsed and then
dried because if you put wet stuff in
hot oil it splashes your face and you
get burned so make sure they're dry put
them in there put your heat on
medium-low
this is not something you want to cook
really super hot put your heat on
medium-low and just let them pan fry all
right in the meantime I'm gonna peel a
couple cloves of garlic alright and
don't chop it I'm just gonna give it a
little whack with the knife I just wanna
bruise it after about ten minutes my
beans started to get a beautiful crust
that skin kind of crinkles up and gets a
little bit crusty and crispy at that
point I hit it with some salt some
pepper some red chilli flakes a couple
sprigs of herb I use summer savory which
is sort of a la looks like rosemary
tastes like thyme
sort of you can use rosemary you could
use thyme you could use both and then
the two cloves of garlic notice they're
just crushed they're not chopped because
then we can pull them out later let that
cook for another five or ten minutes and
to finish a little drizzle of white
vinegar to freshen things up
balance the richness of the beans and
the olive oil with a little bit acid
give that a toss and you're ready to
serve beans are boring come on admit it
but these big beans just begged to be
pan-fried or at least that's the
impression I got anyway I hope you give
this a try go grab a can of butter beans
you might have a can of butter beans in
the cupboard already this is what you
want to do with it great side dish for
the summer grilled meats etc anyway go
to the site all the ingredients are
there and as always enjoy
[Music]
